text: Paul, an apostle (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised Him from the dead),
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the brethren who are with me, Unto the churches of Galatia:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who gave Himself for our sins, that He might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from Him, that called you into the grace of Christ, for another gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is not another; but there are some who trouble you and would pervert the Gospel of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But should we, or an angel from Heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached to you, let him be accursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we said before, so say I now again: If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that which ye have received, let him be accursed!
speaker: Narrator

text: For do I now persuade men, or God? Or do I seek to please men? For if I yet sought to please men, I should not be the servant of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I certify to you, brethren, that the Gospel which was preached by me is not according to man;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I neither received it from man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye have heard of my participation in times past in the Jews’ religion, how I persecuted the church of God beyond measure and wasted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I profited in the Jews’ religion beyond many of my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb and called me by His grace,
speaker: Narrator

text: to reveal His Son in me, that I might preach Him among the heathen, I conferred not immediately with flesh and blood,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me, but I went into Arabia and returned again unto Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I saw none of the other apostles save James, the Lord’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia,
speaker: Narrator

text: and was unknown by face unto the churches of Judea which were in Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: but they had heard only that, “He who persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they glorified God in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then fourteen years later I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that Gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to those who were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But neither was Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, compelled to be circumcised;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that because false brethren were brought in by stealth, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: To them we gave place by submission not even for an hour, that the truth of the Gospel might continue with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of those who seemed to be something (whosoever they were, it maketh no difference to me: God accepteth no man’s person) — those who seemed to be somewhat in consultation added nothing to me;
speaker: Narrator

text: but contrariwise, when they saw that the Gospel to the Uncircumcision was committed unto me, as the Gospel to the Circumcision was unto Peter
speaker: Narrator

text: (for He that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the Circumcision, that Same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles),
speaker: Narrator

text: and when James, Cephas and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship, that we should go unto the heathen and they unto the Circumcision.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only they would that we should remember the poor, the same as I also was eager to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Peter came to Antioch, I withstood him to his face, because he was to be blamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For before certain ones came from James, he ate with the Gentiles; but when they had come, he withdrew and separated himself from them, fearing those who were of the Circumcision.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him, so much that Barnabas also was carried away by their dissimulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the Gospel, I said unto Peter before them all, “If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?
speaker: Narrator

text: We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law; for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is Christ therefore the minister of sin? God forbid!
speaker: Narrator

text: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am crucified with Christ, nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me. And the life which I now live in the flesh, I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not frustrate the grace of God; for if righteousness come by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O foolish Galatians! Who hath bewitched you, that you should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been clearly set forth, crucified among you?
speaker: Narrator

text: This only would I learn of you: Did ye receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
speaker: Narrator

text: Are ye so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain — if it be yet in vain?
speaker: Narrator

text: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit and worketh miracles among you, doeth He it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
speaker: Narrator

text: Even as Abraham “believed God, and it was accounted to him as righteousness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye therefore that those who are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached beforehand the Gospel unto Abraham, saying, “In thee shall all nations be blessed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, those who are of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse; for it is written: “Cursed is every one who continueth not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God is evident, for “the just shall live by faith.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the law is not of faith, but “The man who doeth them shall live in them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us (for it is written, “Cursed is every one who hangeth on a tree”),
speaker: Narrator

text: that the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, I speak after the manner of men: A covenant, though it be but a man’s covenant, yet if it is confirmed, no man annulleth or addeth thereto.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made. He saith not, “and to seeds,” as though many; but as though one: “and to thy Seed,” who is Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this I say, that the Covenant which was confirmed earlier by God in Christ cannot be annulled by the law, which came four hundred and thirty years after, so as to make the promise of no effect.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the inheritance be of the law, it is no more by promise; but God gave it to Abraham by promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what then serveth the law? It was added because of transgressions until the Seed should come to whom the promise was made; and itwas ordained by angels through the hand of a mediator.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a mediator is not a mediator of one, but God is one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is the law then against the promises of God? God forbid! For if there had been a law given which could have given life, verily righteousness should then have come by the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Scripture hath concluded all under sin, that the promise by faith of Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: But before faith came, we were kept under the law, being shut apart from the faith which should afterwards be revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the law was our schoolmaster to bring us unto Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But after faith has come, we are no longer under a schoolmaster.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ, have put on Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female; for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye be Christ’s, then are ye Abraham’s seed and heirs according to the promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I say that the heir, as long as he is a child, differeth in nothing from a servant, though he be lord of all.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he is under tutors and governors until the time appointed by the father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the fullness of the time had come, God sent forth His Son, made of a woman, made under the law,
speaker: Narrator

text: to redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because ye are sons, God hath sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts, crying, “Abba, Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou art no more a servant but a son, and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: However that be, then when ye knew not God, ye did service unto those which by nature are not gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now after ye have known God, or rather are known by God, how turn ye again to the weak and beggarly elements unto which ye desire again to be in bondage?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye observe days and months and times and years.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am afraid for you, lest I have bestowed upon you labor in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, I beseech you, be as I am, for I am as ye are. Ye have not injured me at all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the Gospel unto you at the first.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my temptation which was in my flesh ye despised not, nor rejected, but received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is then the blessedness ye spoke of? For I bear you record that, if it had been possible, ye would have plucked out your own eyes and have given them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: They zealously seek after you, but for no good; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might seek after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is good to be zealously sought after, always in a good thing, and not only when I am present with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: My little children, over whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you,
speaker: Narrator

text: I desire to be present with you now and to change my tone; for I stand in doubt of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell me, ye who desire to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, the one by a bondmaid, the other by a freewoman.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he who was of the bondwoman was born according to the flesh, but he of the freewoman was by promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things are an allegory, for these are the two covenants: The one is from Mount Sinai, which engendereth bondage; this is Hagar.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia and answereth to Jerusalem as it is now, and is in bondage with her children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jerusalem which is above is free, and is the mother of us all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is written: “Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break forth and cry, thou that travailest not; for the desolate hath many more children than she who hath a husband.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as then, he that was born according to the flesh persecuted him that was born according to the Spirit, even so it is now.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless what saith the Scripture? “Cast out the bondwoman and her son, for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman, but of the free.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I, Paul, say unto you that if ye be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I testify again to every man who is circumcised, that he is a debtor to keep the whole law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ then becomes of no effect unto you, whosoever of you claim justification by the law; ye are fallen from grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we, through the Spirit, wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth anything, nor uncircumcision, but faith which worketh by love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye were running well; who hindered you, that ye should not obey the truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: This persuasion cometh not from Him that calleth you.
speaker: Narrator

text: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have confidence in you through the Lord that ye will be not otherwise minded; but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why then do I yet suffer persecution? Then would the offense of the cross cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would that they were even cut off which trouble you!
speaker: Narrator

text: For, brethren, ye have been called unto liberty; only use not liberty for an occasion of the flesh, but by love serve one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this: “Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye not be consumed one by another.
speaker: Narrator

text: This I say then: Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; and these are contrary the one to the other, so that ye cannot do the things that ye would.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye are led by the Spirit, ye are not under the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, and they are these: adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, quarreling, rivalry, wrath, strife, seditions, heresies,
speaker: Narrator

text: envying, murders, drunkenness, revelings, and such like. About these things I tell you again, as I have also told you in times past, that those who do such things shall not inherit the Kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its affections and lusts.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us not be desirous of vainglory, provoking one another and envying one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye who are spiritual restore such a one in the spirit of meekness, considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bear ye one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if a man think himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let every man put to the proof his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every man shall bear his own burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let him that is taught in the Word share with him that teacheth, in all good things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not deceived, God is not mocked; for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let us not be weary in welldoing, for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we therefore have opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto those who are of the household of faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: As many as desire to make a fair showing in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised, only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For not even they themselves who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace be on them and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: From henceforth let no man trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
